title.narrative: MERIT: The Malawi Early Grade Reading Improvement Activity

description.narrative: (Malawi): Malawian students score at the bottom on reading assessments in the Southern African Development Community (SADC) region. Addressing the reading gap is a priority of the Mission and the Ministry of Education, Science, and Technology (MoEST) and led to the creation of the National Reading Program (NRP) for standards 1-4 in 2015. The Malawi Early Grade Reading Improvement (MERIT) activity leads NRP implementation and provides technical and financial support to the MoEST to improve Chichewa and English reading and language skills of over 3,400,000 students in all 5,603 public primary schools nationwide. ..With FY18 funds, MERIT will provide training for teachers, sectional heads, administrators, education advisors, and communities on methods for improving reading instruction. MERIT will continue its mentoring component and introduce Teacher Learning Circles, a structured monthly collaborative dialogue on reading instruction among teachers and education leaders at the school level. This teacher-level support will hone in on teaching skills, discuss student performance, model quality instruction, and improve student reading levels. The activity will support inclusive education for students with disabilities and continue developing high quality teaching and learning materials including teacher training guides and supplementary reading materials for all students. .Implemented by Research Triangle Group and awarded through full and open competition, MERIT employs interventions grounded in research-based pedagogy for improving learners' reading abilities. MERIT operates within existing government structures and through high levels of engagement with the MoEST and local experts. The 2018 U.S.Government Strategy on Basic Education states "equal access to relevant, quality education creates pathways for greater economic growth, improved health outcomes, sustained democratic governance, and more peaceful and resilient societies.".. .

Objectives for Malawi: Implemented by RTI International in all primary schools in Malawi to improve reading performance of Malawian students in standards 1-4. MERIT interventions will improve reading instruction and acquisition in the classroom, increase parental and community engagement in supporting student reading, create safer learning environments for reading, institute pathways for sustainability, and advance USAID/Malawi’s priority of integration across programs.
